item.title: A simple go, gin, and sqlc combination walkthrough
item.description: Well, in this post we will see a partial implementation of a medium.com-like app called Conduit. Take a brief look at the backend implementation specs. As you can see, there are APIs for users, articles, tags, and so on. For now, we will implement user registration and login endpoints; api/users and api/users/login. In the end, we will be able to execute the two curl requests successfully: # 1. user registration request curl --location 'http://localhost:8085/api/users' \ --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \ --data-raw '{ "user": { "username": "johndoe", "email": "johndoe@example.

item.title: About
item.description: Hello there! I’m a backend engineer who thrives on exploring new technologies and integrating them into my expertise, particularly with Golang and Python. In this ever-evolving tech landscape, I find joy in lending a hand and sharing knowledge, fostering a community where innovation and collaboration meet. My altruistic nature, coupled with an ability to quickly adapt and excel, guides me in developing innovative solutions that significantly enhance user experiences. Feel free to delve deeper into my journey and expertise by downloading my resume.
